rounds.category: TO PUT IT IN ANTHROPOLOGICAL TERMS

clues.text: Like marriage or school graduation, this 3-word phrase means an event that marks a person moving from one stage to another
A grouping of only parents & their kids, this term was used in a book title about "Coming of Age in Oppenheimer's Secret City"
Anthropologist Leslie White wrote that "all human behavior originates in the use of" these archetypal representations
To not split up estates, many medieval families followed this 13-letter rule whereby the eldest son got all the land
A theory put forth in 2014 says humans didn't hurry across this "bridge" to North America but lived happily on it for 10,000 years
This character belts out "Let It Go" in "Frozen"
With a nod to its title character, "Axel F" by Harold Faltermeyer was a big hit from this Eddie Murphy movie
Yeah, baby, Madonna's "Beautiful Stranger" plays in the "Austin Powers" movie with this 5-word subtitle
Songs from "Top Gun" include "Mighty Wings" by Cheap Trick & this song by Kenny Loggins
The 3 sailors on leave who sing "New York, New York" in 1949's "On the Town" are Gene Kelly, Jules Munshin & him
It's an abbreviated word for that expensive hoodie sold right outside the music venue
It's an Eastern Orthodox Church head honcho in places like Antioch or Moscow
To be "in the" this center of attention comes from the use of calcium oxide to brighten stages in the 1800s
You'll earn more than that if you know this last name of Alfred, Bruce Wayne's butler
This violet blue flower is a traditional table setting during the Persian New Year

Act II, scene i:
"An orchard beside the house of Brutus", where plotting may or may not occur

Act IV, Scene i:
In "Friar Lawrence's cell", a vial changes hands... ooooops
Act I, Scene IV: "London. The Tower", featuring 1st & 2nd murderer
"The scene, an uninhabited island", but it's very much habited
Reasonably enough, for the whole play it's "Athens and neighbourhood"
This last name that now more often precedes cracker used to precede -ism as a synonym for vegetarianism
Before the 1944 coinage of this word, someone who abstained from dairy products as well as meat was a "strict vegetarian"
You might think of this nut-based liquid as a recent invention, but the term's been around since the 1300s
It's from Chinese words meaning "rotten beans"; enjoy!
This word for a person who chooses to subsist on apples, oranges, pears & the like dates to the 1890s
Parade magazine once answered this age-old question with "to show the armadillo it was possible"
clues.response: Why did the chicken cross the road?

clues.text: Mainstream advertising is sometimes reduced to this Big Apple thoroughfare
This rhyming phrase could be translated as "You have to conform to the way I'm doing things or get on the I-10"
In an Elton John song, it's "where the dogs of society howl"
St. Paul's conversion to Christianity gave us this idiom that now refers to any kind of turning point

rounds.category: A YEAR-O WITH A ZERO IN IT

clues.text: On August 29, 2005 a storm surge from this hurricane rose more than 26 feet, devastating Biloxi & Gulfport
In 1502 he succeeded his uncle Ahuitzotl, becoming the 9th emperor of the Aztecs
The war of this started in its alliterative way in 1701 after Charles II had to go & die all childless & stuff
Founded in 1602 in Amsterdam, this trading company made it through 2 aughts, but missed a 3rd, dissolving in 1799
On February 24, 1803 the Supreme Court declared an act of Congress to be unconstitutional for the first time in this landmark case
Tom Reiss' "The Black Count: Glory, Revolution, Betrayal, & the Real Count of Monte Cristo" is a bio of this author's dad
"Thrive" is a self-help book by this Greek-American who co-founded a website now run by Buzzfeed
4 marriages, but it's been "The Lonely Life" in a memoir by this star of "Jezebel" & "What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?"
This memoir begins with a relative from Nairobi breaking the news about a fatal car accident
This Siddhartha Mukherjee book with a royal title is a history of cancer treatment & research
In this funeral oration for the late Jimmy Carter, President Biden said he "did justly, loved mercy, walked humbly"
Types of geometry include this & non-this
Ear pressure can often be relieved by yawning or swallowing, which opens up these tubes
It takes 3 tricks to win a hand in this card game, once one of the most popular games in America
The honeymoon didn't last long for Orpheus & this nymph who died from a snakebite shortly after the wedding

This variety of musical performance:
"A play representing life in another world, whose inhabitants have no speech but song"

This medical professional:
"A prestidigitator who, putting metal into your mouth, pulls coins out of your pocket"
This event (remember the original title, "The Cynic's Word Book"): "The first & direst of all disasters"

This type of venerated person:
"A dead sinner revised & edited"

This group, then of 90 men:
"A body of elderly gentlemen charged with high duties & misdemeanors"
In 1996 she was born from 3 mothers: one provided the DNA, one provided the egg & one carried the embryo
This newer word often follows "wake up" in a comic political insult directed at conformists
In ads for this company, the counting sheep are baadly unemployed thanks to comfortable mattresses
This processed skin--largely from sheep, goats or calves--was likely named for the ancient city of Pergamum
The AKC says this 2-word dog breed has "dominated competitive sheepdog trials in the British Isles"
There's a full-size one of these between 2 runways at Bangkok's airport, which can't be good for the players' handicaps
During winter months, Munich's airport features a 6,500-square-foot one of these spaces, with a separate curling lane
Slurp up the homemade udon noodles at Kineya Mugimaru, a restaurant at this Tokyo airport that isn't Haneda
For a layover at Roma Fiumicino, you can book one of these in advance, including a towel, gel, hair dryer & slippers
Changi Airport, found here at the tip of the Malay Peninsula, has a butterfly garden with an "emergence cage" for pupae

rounds.text: On June 12, 1942 she wrote, "I hope I will be able to confide everything to you, as I have never been able to confide in anyone"
